issues.summary: Stage - Accounts Payable - Create Invoice/Memo - Split Accounting Item - Apply to All - Selecting Blank against Split Account Assignment wipes out the existing Split distribution data.
issues.description: Environment:  https://stage-go.vroozi.com Username :  asma.latif+APM@vroozi.com Password:  Blueangel1@ Pre-Requisites: AP User should have logged into the Application.   Steps to Reproduce: Click to Create Invoice/Memo.  9000030607 Add a Non Split Item with say qty 1. Select it and Click to Apply to All. Add details and split the item by qty of 0.5 each split. Save the details. Split applies to the item successfully. Again select the Item and click to Apply to All. Add new accounting details along with selecting Blank in the Split Account Assignment field. Save details. Please see yellow error shows.  “Total split quantity not adding up to '1“. View the Item > Accounting Info Tab. Please see Split Distribution has gotten disturbed i.e first split has qty become 0 and 2nd split has been removed. Actual Result: Split Distribution has gotten disturbed i.e first split has qty become 0 and 2nd split has been removed. Expected Result: the system should NOT make any changes to the split accounting status of the selected items. Instead, any fields which have values specified in them, should be updated across all the available accounting segments of all the selected line items. Screen-Cast: Thanks, Asma

issues.summary: Batch-api: SOLR data source not working for Multi-Node environment
issues.description: ISSUE:   Remove SOLR from batch-api Environment:  Stage Pre Conditions: Health check end point is working. Multi Node environment like Stage is used. (Issue is not producible on devqas) Steps to Reproduce: Hit the endpoint  “ http://stage-catalog-1-internal.vroozi.com:8084/health-check “ SOLR is showing as data source in the response and is always unavailable. Upon investigation we have found that this end point is not longer in use and should not be part of the health check for vroozi-batch. Actual Result: SOLR is added as a data source in the response Expected Results: SOLR should be not be added in the data source

issues.summary: PMAN- system update description and type of 2nd line item when user copy any item and update it's description.
issues.description: Server:  https://devqa6-go.vroozi.com/#/login Credentials: Employee:  javaid.sattar+PMemployee@vroozi.com  / Welcome1@ Pre- Requisite: Steps to Reproduce: Login into the above employee user Make a copy of any approved PR having 1 Receivable Item i.e Product and 2 Non-Receivable Items i.e Blanket Type. line item 1 → Product Type line item 2 → Blanket Type line item 3 → Blanket Type now Make a copy of First line item i.e Product type  Update description of copied line item and click on save button Actual: When user try to update description of copied line item and click on save button then system update type and description of Line item 2.  Before update description PR line items type are as follows  line item 1 → Product Type line item 2 → Blanket Type line item 3 → Blanket Type line item 4 → Product Type (Copied Item) After update description PR line items type are as follows  line item 1 → Product Type line item 2 → Product Type (changed from Blanket to Product) line item 3 → Blanket Type line item 4 → Product Type (Copied Item) remain as is. Expected: system should update description of newly copied PR instead of existing Line item 2 Note: The Line Item ID is being duplicated when the user copies an existing line item during POCR, causing the POCR submission to fail with the following validation error message.

issues.summary: C&W Go-Live: Dynamic Workflow Issue
issues.description: Here's the context:  There's a new Vroozi client that is in the Go-live process Their go-live is now blocked due to a design flaw in our PR approval workflows This flaw permits fraudulent PR approvals, which opens up the client to legal liabilities Client's account config details:  They are using the new dynamic workflow engine They have certain users which have the  Employee  and  Approver  roles assigned The Admin has configured certain workflow rules in a way, that such an Employee's PR ends up with the requester themselves for approval.  This person can then potentially approve their own PR, thereby committing financial fraud.  Example scenario: The user (John Doe) has both Employee and Approver roles.  The user has a $10,000 spend limit, and a $100,000 Approval limit.  The user submits a PR for $60,000 The Approval Chain looks like  Approver 1 ($50,000) -> John Doe ($100,000) -> Approver 3 ($500,000) Currently, after the first approver's sign off, John Doe is assigned as the designated Approver on his own PR, as the system isn't built to detect this conflict. So John Doe ends up approving his own PR.  We need to solve this by ensuring that the PR skips John Doe in this case, and goes to Approver 3 instead for the next approval. Note:  The scope of the ticket is limited to the current Go Live Blocker of C&W. We just need to Fix this on the PR and CR document when the document is submitted. On the PR; the requester (Employee / Admin), and on the POCR; the person creating the CR (Employee / Admin / Buyer / Central Receiver) should be skipped from the Approval Chain. Sourcing, Budget Approval step will not require any change.

issues.summary: Add cache mechanism for Accounting Bulk to lookup only for uncached object to improve performance (Mongo Atlas Latency Issue)

We need to improve the performance of the accounting bulk upsert (both sync and async flows) by introducing the cache to accounting db Acceptance Criteria: Use the existing bulk upsert APIs to create/update the accounting Strings Use the time comparison to complete the process before and after the performance update The time taken by the API should be reduced (better if this is improved by more 50%) Test the creation, update and mixed accounting String use cases for 500 records. issues.summary: Budget_Admin: The system should prevent the admin from updating the budget if it contains an invalid accounting string.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should prevent the admin from updating the budget if the associated accounting contains an invalid(deactivated, does not exist) accounting/organization object. Acceptance Criteria: If the admin attempts to update or add any information to the budget definition main screen while there is an accounting string associated with it that contains a deactivated, non-existent, deleted accounting/organization object, or the Object itself was turned Off, the system should prevent the admin from proceeding. For example, If the admin tries to update the budget amount, change the budget duration, add a new accounting string, or change the system’s behavior when the budget is averaged. When the user clicks the  SAVE  button to update the budget with an invalid accounting string, the system should display a red Noty message from the left side of the screen. The red Noty message should read: "This budget cannot be updated because the associated accounting string contains an invalid accounting/organization object(s). Please update the budget after replacing the invalid accounting/organization object."  The Noty message should be a slider. It should stay on the screen for 3 to 5 seconds and then slide away. If the user hovers over the Noty message, it should remain visible as long as the user continues to hover over it. There should be an X icon on the top right corner of the Noty message. Clicking on that should disappear the Noty message. Once the admin updates the accounting string with valid objects, the system should allow the user to proceed with updating the budget.

When Editing an Accounting String, the button label "Add this Accounting String" should be changed to Update.

issues.summary: Budgets_BulkUpload: Admin can upload the Budgets via bulk upload file in CSV Format.
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to be able to upload the Budgets via bulk upload file CSV format. So the system can use them on different documents. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Budgets Master Data Bulk Upload:  →  Upload Budgets Master Data: Here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:    Upload Budgets Master Data: There should be a  Upload Budgets  icon above the top right corner of the accounting string table on the Accounting String screen. (The following image is just for reference.) Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Upload Budgets . Clicking on the  Upload Budgets  icon should open a window where users can select and upload the bulk upload file. The user should be able to use CSV format to upload the budgets. Upon Selecting the file, the system should validate the bulk upload file to verify all the data is valid. The system should save the budget uploaded via bulk upload in the DB in case of valid data in the bulk upload file. A green noty message stating that the file has been uploaded successfully should appear. They should start appearing in the budget table. If there are errors in the files, the system should generate an error report the user can download. (Please refer to the following ‘*Download Budgets Bulk Upload Error Report’* section.) A red noty message stating that the file has failed to upload or there are errors should appear. Only object code usage should be sufficient while uploading through the Bulk Upload. QA must check if our existing Bulk Uploads accept the object’s description while uploading.

issues.summary: Budgets_Admin: Admin can navigate back to main budget definition screen
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to navigate back to the Budget Definition main screen from the Associate Accounting String screen. The system should show the option to go back with saving and without saving the data. Acceptance Criteria: There should be the following two navigation icons on the top corners of the  Associate Accounting String  screen: X  icon: Clicking on that should close the budget definition modal. (existing behavior) |<-  icon: If nothing has been entered on the  Associate Accounting String  screen, the system should simply navigate the user to the main budget definition screen. If some information has been provided on the  Associate Accounting String  screen, the system should display the yellow message and buttons as shown in the mockup. Clicking  Save changes & go back  should associate the accounting string with the budget and navigate the user to the main budget definition screen. (i.e. the  Associate Accounting String  screen should slide away to the right and from the left, the main budget definition screen should appear.) Clicking  Go back without saving changes  should not associate the accounting string with the budget and navigate the user to the main budget definition screen.  In the case of editing the existing accounting screen, clicking the  Go back without saving changes  button should not associate the updated accounting string with the budget. The system should keep the older version of the accounting string.

issues.summary: Budgets_BulkUpload: Admin can download the bulk upload error report.
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the error report if there are any issues in the Budgets Bulk Upload file. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Budgets Master Data Bulk Upload:  →  Download Budgets Bulk Upload Error Report: Here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:    Download Budgets Bulk Upload Error Report: If there are any errors in the Budget Bulk Upload file or processing failure, the system should show a red exclamation: Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Download Error Report . Clicking on the  Download Error Report  icon should download the error report. The system identifies the errors after processing the file: If there are invalid records in the columns of the Budgets Bulk Upload file, the system should mention them in the error report as per the existing standard of bulk upload error report. Please refer to the following pattern. Row# of the file. Issue(s) that causes the error. All errors should be visible in a separate row if a single row has multiple errors. The Processing Failure: The system supports bulk upload files in XLSX and CSV format. If the user tries to upload the file in a format the system does not support, there should be a processing failure report. The error report in the PDF should read ‘Invalid file format. Kindly download the template and use that file format for bulk upload.’. If the user removes any required column from the bulk upload file or provides an invalid column name, the system should provide those details in the PDF error report. The error report should have errors in a separate row in case of multiple errors.

issues.summary: Budgets_BulkUpload: Admin can upload the Budgets via bulk upload file in Excel Format.
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to be able to upload the Budgets via bulk upload file in Excel format. So the system can use them on different documents. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Budgets Master Data Bulk Upload:  →  Upload Budgets Master Data: Here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:    Upload Budgets Master Data: There should be a  Upload Budgets  icon above the top right corner of the accounting string table on the Accounting String screen. (The following image is just for reference.) Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Upload Budgets . Clicking on the  Upload Budgets  icon should open a window where users can select and upload the bulk upload file. The user should be able to use XLSX format to upload the budgets. Upon Selecting the file, the system should validate the bulk upload file to verify all the data is valid. The system should save the budget uploaded via bulk upload in the DB in case of valid data in the bulk upload file. A green noty message stating that the file has been uploaded successfully should appear. They should start appearing in the budget table. If there are errors in the files, the system should generate an error report the user can download. (Please refer to the following ‘ Download Budgets Bulk Upload Error Report’  section.) A red noty message stating that the file has failed to upload or there are errors should appear. Only object code usage should be sufficient while uploading through the Bulk Upload. QA must check if our existing Bulk Uploads accept the object’s description while uploading.

issues.summary: Budgets_BulkUpload: Admin can download the existing Budgets master data
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to download the existing budgets in Vroozi master data. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Budgets Master Data Bulk Upload:  →  Download Existing Budgets Master Data: Here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:    Download Existing Budgets Master Data: There should be an  Export Budgets  icon above the top right corner of the Budgets table on the Accounting String screen. (The following image is just for reference.) Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying  Export Budgets . Clicking on the  Export Budgets  icon should download the template in the xlsx format. When the user clicks on the  Export Budgets  con, the system should show the following overlay that should disappear automatically: The In Progress spinner should appear around the  Export Budgets  icon: Once the file is processed, the following overlay should appear which should disappear automatically: The  Export Budgets  icon should turn green: Clicking on the green  Export Budgets  icon should download the accounting strings file. The name of the downloaded file should be  Budgets-Export-{dateTimeStamp}. The user should be able to Export data in XLSX format if exported data is less than 1 million records. The system should export the data in CSV format if the exported data exceeds 1 million records. Clicking on the  Export Accounting Strings  icon should show an overlay if the accounting strings master data contains more than a million records. There should be an exclamation mark on the overlay. (For reference, please see the mockup below for download In progress) Under the exclamation mark, the overlay message should be “The file you're about to download contains a significant amount of data, and it will be delivered in a CSV format. Would you like to proceed with the download?“. Under the text message, there should be two buttons. Continue Clicking on that should continue the export process. Cancel Clicking on that should abort the export process. When the user clicks on the  Continue  button, the rest of the procedure should remain the same as mentioned in this section. The downloaded data should contain the Objects Code and Description (As happening in other Bulk Upload mechanisms in our system) In the case of multiple accounting strings, the system should create a separate row.

issues.summary: Budgets_BulkUpload: Admin can download the Budget Bulk Upload template
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to download the Budgets bulk upload template. So I can fill in the desired fields and upload them. In the download template, there should be two tabs(sheets): Budget Bulk Upload In this sheet(tab), the following column should be there:(Please create their enums according to the existing bulk upload standards in our system) Row Number Budget Name Description Amount Start Date The user should be able to provide the Start date of the budget. The system should calculate the end date of the budget based on the Duration. Duration The user should be able to select one of the following durations of the budget. The system should calculate the end date based on the given start date. WEEKLY MONTHLY QUARTERLY SEMI_ANNUALY YEARLY The user should provide these enums in CAPS, but the system should be able to accept enums irrespective of their case. All the Company Object fields All the Accounting Object fields When Over Budget We will use the following enums for the three options that appear on the UI BLOCK_SUBMISSION: for option,  The system should not allow the user to submit the purchase request or purchase order. SUBMIT_FOR_APPROVAL: for option,   The system should allow the user to submit the purchase request or purchase order, but require a budget approver on it. SUBMIT_WITHOUT_APPROVAL: for option,  The system should allow the user to submit the purchase request or purchase order, without any additional approvals. The user should provide these enums in CAPS, but the system should be able to accept enums irrespective of their case. Budget Approver The system will display all the associated budget approvers with comma separation. While uploading budgets, this column will only accept input when the  SUBMIT_FOR_APPROVAL  enum   is given in the  When Over Budget  column. Status Delete Instructions In this sheet(tab), the instructions for each column’s input from the  Budgets Bulk Upload  sheet should be there.  For reference, Please click the following   file.

issues.summary: Budgets_Purchase: The system should fetch the budgets on the line item modal with the updated Budget query
issues.description:
Business Case: The system should use the updated budget query to fetch the budgets on the line item modal. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Associate Accounting Strings of any accounting and organization objects in combination with budgets:  →  Budget Fetching Query Enhancement: Here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:    Currently, the budget fetching query on the  Line Item  and  Apply to All  modal is: find 
(     (costCenter = enteredValue OR costCenter is Empty)
  AND (GL = enteredValue OR GL is Empty)
  AND (companyCode = enteredValue OR companyCode is Empty)
  AND (purchasingOrganization = enteredValue OR purchasingOrganization is Empty)
  AND (plant = enteredValue OR plant is Empty)
) The above query only considers the objects that are ON for the unitID The above budget query should now handle all the Organization and Accounting objects: find 
(     (companyCode = enteredValue OR companyCode is Empty)
  AND (purchasingOrganization = enteredValue OR purchasingOrganization is Empty)
  AND (plant = enteredValue OR plant is Empty)
  AND (selectedCostObject = enteredValue OR selectedCostObject is Empty)
  AND (GL = enteredValue OR GL is Empty)
  AND (Customer = enteredValue OR Customer is Empty)
  AND (Class = enteredValue OR Class is Empty)
  AND (Project = enteredValue OR Project is Empty)
  AND (locationType = enteredValue OR locationType is Empty)
  AND (location = enteredValue OR location is Empty)
)
 This updated query should only consider the objects that are ON for the unitID We will update the budget query soon as it is intricate and very cumbersome to understand. Impacted Areas: PR CR PO POCR Impacted Users: Admin Requester Sourcing Approver Financial Approver Buyer Central Receiver

issues.summary: Budgets_Admin: Admin can see the turned off accounting objects in accounting strings associated with budgets
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the accounting and company objects as part of the accounting strings associated with the budget. Even if the accounting/company object is turned off, deactivated, or deleted until I explicitly remove that object from the accounting string. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Associate Accounting Strings of any accounting and organization objects in combination with budgets:  →  Admin can see the turned-off accounting object column in the accounting string associated with the Budget:: Here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:    Admin can see the turned-off accounting object column in the accounting string associated with the Budget: The system should not hide the turned-off accounting/company object and its value from the Accounting String displayed in the ‘ This Budget is associated with ’ section when the instances of the turned-off accounting/company object are part of the accounting strings associated with the budget. The system should highlight the turned-off accounting/company object and its value in yellow color. Next to the yellow highlighted object and its value, there should be a help  text icon(question mark). (We will require help from FE guys to create a mockup for this)  Hovering on should read “ This accounting object is turned off. You are seeing it because the accounting string has the instance of the turned-off object. ” The system should persist the turned-off accounting/company object field on the  Associate Accounting String  modal until the user explicitly removes the value of the turned-off accounting/company object. The Accounting Object value should be turned yellow followed by a help text icon(question mark). (We will require help from FE guys to create a mockup for this) Hovering on should read “ This accounting object is turned off. You are seeing it because the accounting string has the instance of the turned-off object. This accounting string cannot be updated while having this value. ” When the user removes the value from the turned OFF object field should automatically disappear when the user removes the value from it. The system should not show the turned-off object in the Accounting Category dropdown for Cost Object. The system should hide the turned-off accounting/company object and its value from the Accounting String displayed in the ‘ This Budget is associated with ’ section when no instances of the turned-off accounting/company object are part of the accounting strings associated with the budget. The system should not hide the turned-off accounting/company object and its value from the Accounting String displayed in the ‘ This Budget is associated with ’ section when the inactive/deleted instances of the accounting/company object are part of the accounting strings associated with the budget. The system should persist the accounting/company object field on the  Associate Accounting String  modal until the user explicitly removes the inactive/deleted value of the accounting/company object. The Accounting Object value should be turned yellow followed by a help text icon(question mark). (We will require help from FE guys to create a mockup for this) Hovering on should read “ Item has been deactiavted or deleted. This accounting string cannot be updated while having this value. ” The user should be able to remove the inactive/deleted instance. The user should be able to select another instance from the type ahead of that accounting/company object field. The inactive/deleted instance should no longer be visible in the type ahead of the field. Question Answer Q asked by …  Q asked on … A provided by … A provided on …

issues.summary: Budgets_Admin: Admin can see the updated "This Budget is Associated with the" section on the Create/Edit Budget modal.
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the new changes in the  This Budget is Associated with  section of the  Create/Edit Budget  modal. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD except  point#8 :  Associate Accounting Strings of any accounting and organization objects in combination with budgets:  →  Update Associate this budget with Section: here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:  The  point#8  has been implemented separately in    Update Associate this budget with Section: Here is the updated ‘ Associate this budget   with’  section: The label of the section should be  This Budget is associated with . If no accounting string is associated with the budget, the message ‘ No accounting string is associated with this budget yet. ’ should appear. The listed accounting strings should be read-only. If the associated accounting string has up to three objects, all of them should be visible The pattern should be  object1Label: value, object2Label: value, and object3lable: value . If the associated accounting string has more than three objects, the system should show the first three followed by the sentence ‘ x more other elements.’ The pattern should be  object1Label: value, object2Label: value, object3lable: value and 3 more elements . If an object has no value, that should not be visible in the pattern in the listing section. The pattern sequence should be similar to the system on the  Associate Accounting String  modal. All the objects having custom labels should be visible with their custom labels.  The listed accounting strings should show only the code of the Objects. All the objects having custom labels should be visible with their custom labels.  There should be a  Delete  icon next to every listed accounting string. If a user clicks the  Delete  icon, the system should remove the accounting string from the ‘ Associate this budget   with’  section.

issues.summary: Budgets_Admin: Admin can see the new Associate Accounting String child screen while udpating/viewing the existing accounting string
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the new  Associate Accounting String  screen when I click the  →  button from the  This budget is associated with  section of the   Create/Edit Budget  modal. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to  point#8  of the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Associate Accounting Strings of any accounting and organization objects in combination with budgets:  →  Update Associate this budget with Section: here is the link to the relevant point of the requirements in the BRD:     For more details about the  Associate Accounting String  modal, please also refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Associate Accounting Strings of any accounting and organization objects in combination with budgets:  →  Associate Accounting String child screen:  Here is the link to the relevant section in the BRD:  Here is the link to the ticket in which  Associate Accounting String  modal is implemented:    After the  Delete  icon against the associated accounting strings in the ' This Budget is Associated with'  section of the  Create/Edit Budget  modal, there should be a  ->  icon. If a user clicks the  ->  icon, the system should slide the main  Budget  Screen to the left and slide in the  Associate Accounting String  modal from the right. The  Associate Accounting String  modal should be pre-filled with all the existing values of that particular accounting string. The user should be able to edit the accounting string accordingly.

issues.summary: Budgets_Admin: Admin can see the new Associate Accounting String child screen while associating a new accounting string
issues.description: Business Case: As an admin, I want to see the new  Associate Accounting String  screen when I click the  Add a New Accounting String button  from the  Create/Edit Budget  modal. Acceptance Criteria: Please refer to the following section of the requirements in the BRD:  Associate Accounting Strings of any accounting and organization objects in combination with budgets:  →  Associate Accounting String child screen: Here is the link to the relevant section in the BRD:    Associate Accounting String child screen: Clicking on  Add New Accounting String  button(refer to   ) should slide the current screen of the modal to the left and slide in a new screen from the right. That new screen should allow the user to associate the accounting string with any combination of accounting and organization objects. The label of the modal should be   Associate Accounting String. There should be two sections on the  Associate Accounting String  modal: Company Info. This section should contain the following fields Company Code.  (type ahead field) Purchasing Org . (type ahead field) Plant  (type ahead field) If any object from the above list is off for the unit ID, the system should not show that field on this modal. (Existing functionality and should be extended to this new  Associate Accounting String  modal) All the objects having custom labels should be visible with their custom labels.  Accounting Info. This section should contain the following fields: Accounting Category  (Drop Down) This dropdown should appear if at least one of the cost objects is ON for the unitID. The system should not show this drop-down if no cost object is ON for the unitID. There should be the following options in the drop-down based on how many of them are ON for the unitID Cost Center WBS Internal Order Profit Center Selecting any option from the above list should show that field beneath the  Accounting Category . Cost Object  (type ahead) The label should appear based on the selected option from the  Accounting Category  dropdown.  GL Account  (type ahead) Customer  (type ahead) Class  (type ahead) Project  (type ahead) Location Type  (type ahead) Location  (type ahead) If any  Accounting Object  from the above list is off for the unit ID, the system should not show that field on this modal. (Existing functionality and should be extended to this new  Associate Accounting String  modal) All the objects having custom labels should be visible with their custom labels.  According to the existing logic, the system should fetch Accounting Objects in the type ahead. The existing logic is the objects are generally fetched based on their pairing with the Company Code in the Accounting Master Data. The  Customer  is fetched based on their pairing with the  Company Code, Cost Object, GL Account, and Project in the Accounting Master Data. The  Location  is fetched based on their paring with the Company Code, Location Type, Plant, and Class in the Accounting Master Data. The Cost Object dictates the Company Code selection If the  Dictate Via Company Code  toggle is OFF based on their paring in the Accounting Master Data.  In this case, The placement of  Company Info  and  Accounting Info  sections should be flipped. (As happens on Line Item Modal) There should be the following buttons on the bottom of the  Associate Accounting String  screen while associating a new accounting string: (Please note that the following button should only handle the Accounting String association/removal with the budget. The complete budget object can be saved only from the main budget definition modal) Add this Accounting String  button(In the mockup, it is depicted as a  Save  button) It should remain disabled until the user fills in at least one field from the  Company  or  Accounting Info  section. Add this Accounting String  button color should be blue. Once at least one field from the  Company  or  Accounting Info  section has value, the  Add this Accounting String  button should become enabled.  Clicking the  Add this Accounting String  button should associate the  Accounting String  with the  Budget . The  Associate Accounting String  modal should slide to the right  The main  Budget  screen should slide in from the left. The newly associated Accounting String should be listed in the  Associate this budget with  section. Remove this Accounting String  button(In the mockup, it is depicted as a  Cancel  button) Clicking that should not associate the Accounting String with the budget. In case editing the existing accounting string, clicking the  Remove this Accounting String  button will remove the association of the Accounting String with the budget. The  Associate Accounting String  screen should slide to the right  The main  Budget  screen should slide in from the left. There should be the following two navigation icons on the top corners of the  Associate Accounting String  screen: X  icon: Clicking on that should close the budget definition modal. (existing behavior) |<-  icon: If nothing has been entered on the  Associate Accounting String  screen, the system should simply navigate the user to the main budget definition screen. If some information has been provided on the  Associate Accounting String  screen, the system should display the yellow message and buttons as shown in the mockup. Clicking  Save changes & go back  should associate the accounting string with the budget and navigate the user to the main budget definition screen. (i.e. the  Associate Accounting String  screen should slide away to the right and from the left, the main budget definition screen should appear.) Clicking  Go back without saving changes  should not associate the accounting string with the budget and navigate the user to the main budget definition screen.  In the case of editing the existing accounting screen, clicking the  Go back without saving changes  button should not associate the updated accounting string with the budget. The system should keep the older version of the accounting string. In case of a duplicate Accounting String being associated with the Budgets, the system should show a noty message.  Currently, the noty message appears when the user adds a duplicate string on the Create/Edit Budget modal. Now, the system should display that same noty message when the user tries to add a duplicate string by clicking the  Save  button from the Associate Accounting String modal. Any change in the accounting string on the  Associate Accounting String  modal should be captured in the Budget Audit Trail. Impacted Users: Admin Budget Approver(With Create and/or Edit rights)

epic.summary: Payables: AP: System able to use Document Settings for accounting elements in AP Documents.
epic.description: This epic focuses on integrating the system settings from Documents -> Settings -> All Documents into the Accounts Payable (AP) documents. The objective is to ensure that AP documents can utilize these settings, enhancing their configurability and alignment with organizational requirements. The key components of this epic include: Utilize Document Settings in AP Documents. Location Field Configuration. Class Field Configuration. Project Field Configuration. Customer Field Configuration. Account Category (Cost Center, WBSE, Internal Order, Profit Center) Field Configuration. GL Account Field Configuration. Plant Field Configuration.

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: System uses settings in Documents -> Settings -> All Documents to make Location, Class, Customer and Project hidden.
issues.description: User Story: As an AP user , I want the settings in Documents → Settings → All Documents to dictate if  Location, Class, Customer, and Project  should be hidden on AP documents  so that  the behavior is consistent on all documents. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  The system uses the settings in Documents → Settings → All Documents to dictate if Location, Class, Customer and Project should be hidden on AP documents. Which customers should this change impact? All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true, and All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true All customers who have PAYMENT_REQUEST = true What pages should this change impact?  The invoice, memo and  payment request  pages. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who are able to edit an AP document, namely: The document owner (AP Processor/Manager), Admin, Assignee, e.g. an AP Coder, an Exception Handler, an Approver, and Any AP Manager. Payment Requester . How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Admin has enabled one or more of these accounting objects in Master Data → Accounting page. Location. Class. Customer. Project. The Admin has selected Hidden against the Location  / Class / Customer / Project field in the Documents → Settings → All Documents page. The behavior described below comes into play in the following situations, that is, in any editable state of an AP document: Document is in  ,  , or  Document being edited in   or   statuses. Document being edited while it is pending approval. Document being edited after it is approved, in   or   statuses. Document being edited after it is posted, in   status or greater. Feature toggle -   is ON. Location / Class / Customer / Project = HIDDEN All scenarios: The system does  not  showcase the Location / Class / Customer / Project field in the line item section. General Rule: Errors: The system does  not  display any errors related Location / Class / Customer / Project. Apply All: Important Note:  The system exactly mimics the behavior of the Apply All modal of PRs. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Yes. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes – both documents in process and historically processed documents. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: Introduce a feature toggle for utilizing the Documents -> Settings -> All Documents settings in AP documents.
issues.description: Proposed Change: Introduce a back-end toggle/setting that will allow the system to decide whether to utilize the settings configured under Documents -> Settings -> All Documents for specific accounting elements on AP documents. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  The system will utilize the settings configured under Documents → Settings → All Documents only if this new feature toggle is enabled; otherwise, it will  not . Which customers should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true, ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled and  Payment_Request = True . Note:  The feature toggle is applied to Invoices, Memos and  Payment Request  documents alike. What pages should this change impact?  The invoice, memos and  payment request  pages. Which users should be impacted by the change? Users who are allowed to create AP documents, namely, AP Processors, Managers, and Admins, and Users who are allowed to view / edit AP documents. How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. Default:  This feature toggle should be set to  off  for all existing and new customers, by default. Feature Toggle = Off When the feature toggle is turned OFF, the system should not apply the settings from Documents -> Settings -> All Documents to the AP documents. The fields Location, Class, Customer, and Project should retain their default behavior, ignoring any configurations set under Documents -> Settings -> All Documents. The fields Cost Center, WBSE, Internal Order, Profit Center, GL Account and Plant should retain their default behavior, ignoring any configurations set under Documents -> Settings -> All Documents. Feature Toggle = On When the feature toggle is turned ON, the system should use the settings in Documents -> Settings -> All Documents to determine the Required / Optional / Hidden settings for Location, Class, Customer, and Project fields on AP documents. When the feature toggle is turned ON, the system should use the settings in Documents -> Settings -> All Documents to determine the Required / Optional / Hidden settings for Cost Center, WBSE, Internal Order, Profit Center, GL Account and Plant fields on AP documents. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Maybe. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes – both documents in process and historically processed documents. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks                     Key Decisions: # Decision Point Decision Reasoning Validation Plan 1 How should we handle documents created before this feature goes in to Production? 2 Identical to the question above, how should we handle the situation when the feature toggle is enabled initially and then disabled at a later point?

issues.summary: PMAN: AP: System uses settings in Documents -> Settings -> All Documents to make Customer optional / required.
issues.description: User Story: As an AP user , I want the settings in Documents → Settings → All Documents to dictate if  Customer  should be optional, or required on AP documents  so that  the behavior is consistent on all documents. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  The system uses the settings in Documents → Settings → All Documents to dictate if Customer should be optional, or required on AP documents. Which customers should this change impact? All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true, and All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true All customers who have PAYMENT_REQUEST = true What pages should this change impact?  The invoice, memo and  payment request  pages. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who are able to edit an AP document, namely: The document owner (AP Processor/Manager), Assignee, e.g. an AP Coder, an Exception Handler, an Approver, and Any AP Manager. Payment Requester . How should this feature work? Pre-Requisites: Conditions in AC #2 are fulfilled. The Admin has selected one of the following against the Customer field in the Documents → Settings → All Documents page. The behavior described below comes into play in the following situations, that is, in any editable state of an AP document: Document is in  ,  , or  Document being edited in   or   statuses. Document being edited while it is pending approval. Document being edited after it is approved, in   or   statuses. Document being edited after it is posted, in   status or greater. Feature toggle -   is ON. Customer = REQUIRED Note:  The Customer field mimics the exact behavior of the  GL Account  field, as described below. In any editable state (in any status), a user is able to save a line item without specifying a value in the Customer field. The system instantly showcases a  “Line Item #n: Field ‘Customer’ missing”  error message, as soon as the user saves the line item. Draft, Parked, or Rejected: When the system showcases the error listed above, the user is unable to process the document further, that is, they’re only able to see the following actions/transitions: Park, Assign, and Coding. Pending: When the system showcases the error listed above, the user is unable to Approve the document; they’re only able to Reject it. epic.summary: Enhancement of Terms & Conditions Management and Assignment in Purchase Orders
epic.description: Description Objective: This Epic aims to significantly enhance the Terms & Conditions (T&Cs) management and assignment functionalities in our system, addressing specific needs of our clients, Yukon and Maersk. The primary goal is to provide flexibility and control in the creation, assignment, and management of T&Cs for Purchase Orders (POs), both auto-generated and manually created. Key Features: Admin Capabilities for T&Cs Management: Enable Company Admins to author and manage multiple custom T&Cs. Provide functionality to set default T&Cs and associate custom T&Cs with specific suppliers and/or company codes. Dynamic T&Cs Assignment: Automate the assignment of correct T&Cs to POs based on supplier and/or company code. Buyer Permissions & Capabilities: Empower Buyers with permissions to edit T&Cs on POs, including the use of a rich text editor for ad-hoc T&Cs, with options to save these either for single-use or in their profile for future reuse. PO Change Request (POCR) Enhancements: Implement functionality for Buyers to update T&Cs on POs via POCR, with tracking of changes in the document history UI. Restricted Access for Requesters: Prevent the original requester from altering T&Cs on POs through the POCR function. Admin Overrides and Approvals: Allow Admins to modify T&Cs on POs via POCR, subject to Buyer approval for manually created/transmitted POs. Stakeholders: Primary: Yukon and Maersk Vroozi Divisions: Management, Sales / Marketing, Customer Success, Implementation, Support, Product, Engineering Vroozi Functional teams: Purchase Team, Payables Team ( — ?), Integration Team ( ?) Timeline and Milestones: Start Date: ASAP Completion Target: May 2024, within Q2 2024 Dependencies and Risks: Application Roles Effected : Company Admins, Buyers Payables Team Cooperation: Required for updating POs in the Supplier Portal. Integration Team Involvement: Potential need for integrating T&Cs communication via cXML POs, which could impact project timeline. Success Criteria: Effective implementation of T&Cs management and assignment system enhancements. Improved flexibility and control for Admins and Buyers in handling T&Cs. Seamless integration with existing systems and processes. Positive feedback from primary stakeholders, Yukon and Maersk. Milestones: MVP - Minimum Viable Product: Product manager to validate assumptions and solution design with stakeholders. Engineering to complete    MUP - Minimum Useable Product:                                     Purchase Order: Allow Buyers to create and associate Ad-hoc T&Cs to a specific PO Purchase Order: Print the correct T&Cs on the PO PDF Vroozi Admin: Allow Admins to specify whether PO T&Cs can be updated via the POCR function POCR: Allow only the “PO Owner” to update T&Cs via POCR POCR: Record and display T&Cs changes done on a PO, in the PO Document Change History Integration team  → SPIKE: Integration team needs to investigate impact on NBCU, if T&Cs can be updated vai POCR Payables team  → Supplier Portal: Display PO T&Cs in the Vroozi Supplier Portal Payables team  → Supplier Portal: Ensure SP users are able to Confirm / Dispute T&Cs changes on a PO updated via POCR MLP - Minimum Lovable Product: Vroozi Admin: Figure out how to introduce an “Apply to All” option for associations SPIKE: Investigate how we can compute, store and display a fine grained “Diff” for the T&Cs content, when updated by an Admin         Integration team  →     POCR: Allow Admins to update the T&Cs on a PO via POCR POCR: Allow Central Reciever to update the T&Cs on a PO via POCR POCR: Ensure that T&Cs updates on POs; done via POCR, are reviewed and approved by the “PO Owner” Vroozi PMAN: Allow Buyers, Admins, Central Receivers to create custom T&Cs and save them in their user profile for reuse at a later date Vroozi PMAN: Allow users to view and manage their custom T&Cs from their “My Data” screen   The wireframes for this project can also be found here:

issues.summary: POCR: Based on assigned user permissions, allow a user to create Ad-hoc T&Cs
issues.description: Business Case: TBD …  Acceptance Criteria: Pre-requisites: The feature flag defined in   must be enabled for the unitID. The unitID should be configured to use the “Custom Terms & Conditions” option on the  Admin Panel → Documents → Purchase Orders  screen. The system should already allow creation and management of multiple T&Cs, as well as allowing a default set of T&Cs to be designated for the unitID. As defined in: The system must already support the additional permissions added for Buyers in  The unitID must be configured to allow editing of T&Cs during POCR, as defined in  The user doing the POCR must be a Buyer with both the “Edit PO T&Cs” & “Create Ad-hoc PO T&Cs“ permissions. The PO must already have T&Cs assigned to the PO     Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Buyer Data-Fix Necessity Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be: TBD …     How should the auto-assigned T&Cs be displayed on a DRAFT PO? The system should show the assigned T&Cs on the PO, exactly where they’re displayed today on the DRAFT PO. Towards the bottom of the document, above the action buttons. The T&Cs section should ONLY be visible if there are T&Cs assigned to the PO. The height of the T&Cs section should be capped, to be the same as the adjacent “Notes to Supplier” section. The T&Cs section should be titled “Terms & Conditions” This section should display the unique name of the assigned T&Cs, in a type-ahead field This section should display the content of the assigned T&Cs If the content doesn’t fit into the fixed height of this section, it should be truncated and the body of text should end with an ellipsis ( … ), so the user understands that there is more content. This section should include a new button with a “pencil” icon on it.  This button should be inline with the T&Cs name field When the user hovers over this button, they should see a tool-tip with the text “Create new Terms & Conditions“   What should happen when the user clicks into the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it? When the user clicks into the type-ahead field … The system should automatically remove the previously selected T&Cs from the field The system should display a drop-down menu listing upto 10 of the active, applicable T&Cs that could be assigned to the current PO This list should be scrollable if needed If the BE returns more applicable T&Cs as options, than can be shown in this list, the last element in the list should be an ellipsis ( … ), so the user can understand that there’s more data There should be no change to the name or the content of the T&Cs that are already assigned to the PO. if the user clicks away from this field, the field’s state should revert back to what it was before the user clicked into it.   What should happen when the user types is the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it? if the user begins typing into the type-ahead field, the system should search through the list of applicable T&Cs returned by the BE for this particular PO. The user should only be able to trigger the search function by typing in the name of a set of active, applicable T&Cs from their unitID. The search function should not be triggered till the user has entered at least 2 chars. The system should present a filtered/narrowed result set with every additional character entered by the user. The list of options visible in the drop-down list should update in real-time as the result set is updated.   What should happen when the user clicks on one of the options listed in the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it? If the user clicks on one of the visible options in the drop-down list … The system should replace the name and content of the previously assigned T&Cs from the T&Cs section on the PO The drop-down list should no longer be visible The type-ahead field should now be populated with the name of the newly selected T&Cs The section should update to display the name and content of the newly selected T&Cs Any visual artifacts when updating this data should be restricted to the T&Cs section and NOT affect the rest of the application/document UI   When should the system display a “Show more …” link in the T&Cs section? If the T&Cs section is showing truncated content, then there should be a “Show more …” link below the body of text. Whether or not this link is visible, should NOT affect the total height of the T&Cs section. This link should be clickable by the user.   What should the user see when they click on the “Show more …” link? When the user clicks on the “Show more …” link, the system should display a modal to the user. The document behind the modal should appear in a dimmed state; as is standard across the application. This modal should have the tile “Terms & Conditions“ This modal should display the unique name of the assigned T&Cs, in a type-ahead field This modal should include a new button with a “pencil” icon on it.  This button should be inline with the T&Cs name field The button should also have the label “Create new Terms & Conditions“, in addition to the icon This modal should display the optional description of the assigned T&Cs If there is no description provided for the assigned T&Cs, then the description field should NOT be visible on the UI. This modal should display the entire content of the assigned T&Cs The section of the modal displaying the T&Cs content should be scrollable, if there is more content than can be displayed in the section’s viewport. This modal should have a standard “x” button on the top right to close the modal and return the user to the DRAFT PO screen. This modal should have 2 additional action buttons at the bottom: Cancel Save   What should happen when the user clicks into the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it, on the modal? When the user clicks into the type-ahead field … The system should automatically remove the previously selected T&Cs from the field The system should display a drop-down menu listing upto 10 of the active, applicable T&Cs that could be assigned to the current PO This list should be scrollable if needed If the BE returns more applicable T&Cs as options, than can be shown in this list, the last element in the list should be an ellipsis ( … ), so the user can understand that there’s more data There should be no change to the name or the content of the T&Cs that are already assigned to the PO. if the user clicks away from this field, the field’s state should revert back to what it was before the user clicked into it.   What should happen when the user types is the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it, on the modal? if the user begins typing into the type-ahead field, the system should search through the list of applicable T&Cs returned by the BE for this particular PO. The user should only be able to trigger the search function by typing in the name of a set of active, applicable T&Cs from their unitID. The search function should not be triggered till the user has entered at least 2 chars. The system should present a filtered/narrowed result set with every additional character entered by the user. The list of options visible in the drop-down list should update in real-time as the result set is updated.   What should happen when the user clicks on one of the options listed in the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it, on the modal? If the user clicks on one of the visible options in the drop-down list … The system should replace the name and content of the previously assigned T&Cs from the modal The drop-down list should no longer be visible The type-ahead field should now be populated with the name of the newly selected T&Cs The content section of the modal should update to display the name, optional description and content of the newly selected T&Cs Any visual artifacts when updating this data should be restricted to the T&Cs section and NOT affect the rest of the application/document UI What should happen when the user clicks on the “Create new Terms & Conditions“ button, on the modal? When the user clicks on this button, the UI controls on the modal should disappear, and be replaced by a UI to facilitate the creation of an Ad-hoc set of T&Cs for the current PO.  The new UI should have the same title for the modal; “Terms & Conditions“.  This new UI should have the same 2 additional action buttons at the bottom: Cancel Save The main section of the modal should include a “back” button allowing the user to exit the T&Cs creation UI and go back to the original state of the modal.  inline with this back button, there should be a text label “Create Custom Terms & Conditions“ There should be a “?” help icon next to this label If the user hovers over it, they should see a tool-tip with the text “Create a new set of custom Terms & Conditions that will be associated with this Purchase Order. This new set of Terms & Conditions will not be available for use outside of this Purchase Order.“ The user should have access to the following input fields:  Name Description “ Content ” The Name field should be required The Description field should be optional The “ Content ” field should be identical to the rich text editing system shown in the Admin Panel for authoring custom T&Cs. This field should be required.  What should happen when the user clicks on the “Create new Terms & Conditions“ button, on the T&Cs section on the POCR document? When the user clicks on the new “Create new Terms & Conditions“ button on the main DRAFT PO screen …  The system should display the Terms & Conditions modal  The modal should directly open in the Ad-hoc T&Cs creation mode as described in the section titled “ What should happen when the user clicks on the “Create new Terms & Conditions“ button, on the modal? “ What should happen when the user clicks on the “back“ button, on the create T&Cs view on the modal? The user should be navigated back to the parent screen on the Terms & Conditions modal, displaying the currently assigned T&Cs content in it.  What should happen when the user clicks on the “Save” button on the modal? When the user clicks on the “Save” button … The modal should disappear and the user should be returned to the DRAFT PO screen The assigned T&Cs on the PO should be updated The T&Cs section on the DRAFT PO should be updated to reflect this change.   What should happen when the user clicks on the “Cancel” button on the modal? When the user clicks on the “Cancel” button … The modal should disappear and the user should be returned to the DRAFT PO screen There should be no change to any of the data in the PO. How can a Buyer get back to the Ad-hoc T&Cs they were working on, and continue editing the content? Change the text in tooltip from “Create custom Terms & Conditions” to “Edit custom Terms & Conditions” The icon should stay as it is. When the user clicks on the “Edit custom Terms & Conditions” button The T&Cs details modal should reopen The modal should open in the state used for editing the Ad-hoc T&Cs The relevant fields on the UI should be pre-populated with the appropriate content, from the Ad-hoc T&Cs already assigned to the document   How can a Buyer get to the Ad-hoc T&Cs they were working on and continue editing the content, after clicking on the “show more …” link? If the Ad-hoc T&Cs has more content than is displayed on the PO document itself, and the user clicks on the “show more …” link The T&Cs details modal should reopen The modal should open in the state used for editing the Ad-hoc T&Cs The relevant fields on the UI should be pre-populated with the appropriate content, from the Ad-hoc T&Cs already assigned to the document If the user happens to click on the “back” button in this screen, they should be navigated by the system to the read-only view of the modal, with the contents of the Ad-hoc T&Cs displayed on the screen. The user should be able to use the type-ahead field to select and preview another set of custom T&Cs from the unitID’s library of available T&Cs. Alternate custom T&Cs; from the unitID library, will only be applied to the PO if the user clicks on the “Save Changes” button. They should be able to get back to the editing view by clicking on the “Edit custom Terms & Conditions” button on this screen.   How can the user save their updates/changes to the Ad-hoc T&Cs? On the T&Cs details modal; with the Ad-hoc T&Cs UI displayed and prepopulated with content, the user should be able to modify the values in any of the fields on the UI Instead of the “Save” button, if the user has made any changes in any of the fields, the label of that button should read “Save Changes“ Clicking on this button should assign the updated Ad-hoc T&Cs to the current document   Expected behavior for the “Pencil” button on the T&Cs section on the POCR screen: The icon for the button should remain a pencil. The button tool-tip should read “Create Custom Terms & Conditions“ when the PO has a pre-existing set of custom T&Cs assigned to it. Clicking on this should open the T&Cs details modal in the Create T&Cs view. The button tool-tip should read “Edit Custom Terms & Conditions“ when the PO has an Ad-hoc set of custom T&Cs assigned to it. Clicking on this should open the T&Cs details modal in the Edit T&Cs view, with the Ad-hoc T&Cs content pre-filled.   Switching from a pre-existing set of custom T&Cs to the Ad-hoc T&Cs the user was authoring, on the POCR screen In order to restore the previous Ad-hoc T&Cs the user was authoring, they should be able to click into the typ-ahead field used for T&C selection. In this field, the first option listed should be the set of Ad-hoc T&Cs that the user was previously authoring. Selecting this option should re-apply this set of T&Cs to the PO ( only on the POCR screen ).   Switching from a pre-existing set of custom T&Cs to the Ad-hoc T&Cs the user was authoring, on the T&Cs details modal: In order to restore the previous Ad-hoc T&Cs the user was authoring, they should be able to click into the typ-ahead field used for T&C selection. In this field, the first option listed should be the set of Ad-hoc T&Cs that the user was previously authoring. Selecting this option should load this set of T&Cs on the details screen. The user should be able to re-apply these Ad-hoc T&Cs to the PO by clicking on the SAve button on the modal.   Clicking on the “show more…” link when the PO still has the Ad-hoc T&Cs assigned to it: Clicking on this link should open up the T&Cs details modal, in the Edit mode, with the Ad-hoc T&Cs content pre-filled.   Clicking on the “show more…” link when the PO has a pre-existing set of custom T&Cs assigned to it, after the user changed to it from the Ad-hoc T&Cs: Clicking on this link should open up the T&Cs details modal, in the read-only mode, with the full contents of the selected pre-existing custom T&Cs.
