issues.summary: POCR: Based on assigned user permissions, allow a user to edit T&Cs on a PO
issues.description: Business Case: TBD …  Acceptance Criteria: Pre-requisites: The feature flag defined in   must be enabled for the unitID. The unitID should be configured to use the “Custom Terms & Conditions” option on the  Admin Panel → Documents → Purchase Orders  screen. The system should already allow creation and management of multiple T&Cs, as well as allowing a default set of T&Cs to be designated for the unitID. As defined in: The system must already support the additional permissions added for Buyers in  The unitID must be configured to allow editing of T&Cs during POCR, as defined in    The user doing the POCR must be a Buyer with at least the “Edit PO T&Cs” permission. The PO must already have T&Cs assigned to the PO     Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Buyer Data-Fix Necessity Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be: TBD …   How should the auto-assigned T&Cs be displayed on the POCR screen? The system should show the assigned T&Cs on the PO, exactly where they’re displayed on the DRAFT PO. Towards the bottom of the document, above the action buttons. The T&Cs section should ONLY be visible if there are T&Cs assigned to the PO. The height of the T&Cs section should be capped, to be the same as the adjacent “Notes to Supplier” section. The T&Cs section should be titled “Terms & Conditions” This section should display the unique name of the assigned T&Cs This section should display the content of the assigned T&Cs If the content doesn’t fit into the fixed height of this section, it should be truncated and the body of text should end with an ellipsis ( … ), so the user understands that there is more content.   When should the system display a “Show more …” link in the T&Cs section? If the T&Cs section is showing truncated content, then there should be a “Show more …” link below the body of text. Whether or not this link is visible, should NOT affect the total height of the T&Cs section. This link should be clickable by the user.   What should the user see when they click on the “Show more …” link? When the user clicks on the “Show more …” link, the system should display a modal to the user. The document behind the modal should appear in a dimmed state; as is standard across the application. This modal should have the tile “Terms & Conditions“ This modal should display the unique name of the assigned T&Cs, in a type-ahead field This modal should display the optional description of the assigned T&Cs If there is no description provided for the assigned T&Cs, then the description field should NOT be visible on the UI. This modal should display the entire content of the assigned T&Cs The section of the modal displaying the T&Cs content should be scrollable, if there is more content than can be displayed in the section’s viewport. This modal should have a standard “x” button on the top right to close the modal and return the user to the DRAFT PO screen. This modal should have 2 additional action buttons at the bottom: Cancel Save What should happen when the user clicks into the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it? When the user clicks into the type-ahead field …  The system should display a drop-down menu of the active, applicable T&Cs that could be assigned to the current PO This list should be scrollable if needed If the BE returns more applicable T&Cs as options, than can be shown in this list, the last element in the list should be an ellipsis ( … ), so the user can understand that there’s more data There should be no change to the name or the content of the T&Cs that are already assigned to the PO.  if the user clicks away from this field, the field’s state should revert back to what it was before the user clicked into it.    What should happen when the user types is the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it? if the user begins typing into the type-ahead field, the system should search through the list of applicable T&Cs returned by the BE for this particular PO.  The user should only be able to trigger the search function by typing in the name of a set of active, applicable T&Cs from their unitID. The search function should not be triggered till the user has entered at least 2 chars.  The system should present a filtered/narrowed result set with every additional character entered by the user.  The list of options visible in the drop-down list should update in real-time as the result set is updated.  What should happen when the user clicks on one of the options listed in the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it? If the user clicks on one of the visible options in the drop-down list …  The system should replace the name and content of the previously assigned T&Cs from the T&Cs section on the PO The drop-down list should no longer be visible The type-ahead field should now be populated with the name of the newly selected T&Cs The section should update to display the name and content of the newly selected T&Cs  Any visual artifacts when updating this data should be restricted to the T&Cs section and NOT affect the rest of the application/document UI   What should happen when the user types is the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it, on the modal? if the user begins typing into the type-ahead field, the system should search through the list of applicable T&Cs returned by the BE for this particular PO.  The user should only be able to trigger the search function by typing in the name of a set of active, applicable T&Cs from their unitID. The search function should not be triggered till the user has entered at least 2 chars.  The system should present a filtered/narrowed result set with every additional character entered by the user.  The list of options visible in the drop-down list should update in real-time as the result set is updated.  What should happen when the user clicks on one of the options listed in the type-ahead field with the T&C name in it, on the modal? If the user clicks on one of the visible options in the drop-down list …  The system should replace the name and content of the previously assigned T&Cs from the modal The drop-down list should no longer be visible The type-ahead field should now be populated with the name of the newly selected T&Cs The content section of the modal should update to display the name, optional description and content of the newly selected T&Cs  Any visual artifacts when updating this data should be restricted to the T&Cs section and NOT affect the rest of the application/document UI    What should happen when the user clicks on the “Save” button on the modal? When the user clicks on the “Save” button …  The modal should disappear and the user should be returned to the DRAFT PO screen The assigned T&Cs on the PO should be updated The T&Cs section on the DRAFT PO should be updated to reflect this change.    What should happen when the user clicks on the “Cancel” button on the modal? When the user clicks on the “Cancel” button …  The modal should disappear and the user should be returned to the DRAFT PO screen There should be no change to any of the data in the PO.      Question Answer Q asked by … Q asked on … A provided by … A provided on …  What happens when we selected NONE option from the  Admin Panel → Documents → Purchase Orders  →  Terms and Conditions Select dropDown . Then we created a PO  so now there is no TermsAndConditions Id attached to PO now If a POCR is performed in this scenario we don’t have to show a section ? But now If we select CUSTOM from  Terms and Conditions Select dropDown  then go for a POCR now we able to assign custom T&Cs ?  On the POCR screen, when deciding what to show in the T&Cs section, there are 2 conditions that need to be evaluated:  What T&Cs information is present in the source PO? What is the current set of configurations, at the time the Buyer is doing the POCR?  If the source PO does not have any T&Cs data in it, and the unitID is currently configured to not use any T&Cs, then the system should NOT display the T&Cs section on POCR screen.  If the source PO does not have any T&Cs data in it, and the unitID is currently configured to use the default T&Cs, then the system should NOT display the T&Cs section on POCR screen. If the source PO does not have any T&Cs data in it, and the unitID is currently configured to use custom T&Cs, then the system should show the T&Cs section with the taxt “ There aren’t any Terms & Conditions assigned to this Purchase Order currently. “ Whether there will be a type-ahead, or a button to create Ad-hoc T&Cs will depend on the current user’s permissions.  If the source PO has T&Cs assigned to it, and the unitID is currently configured to not use any T&Cs, then the system should display the T&Cs section on the POCR screen, but in read-only mode. With the “ show more … “ feature working if the content of the T&Cs is greater than what can be shown in the limited space on the POCR document.  If the source PO has T&Cs assigned to it, and the system is currently configured to use the default T&Cs, then the system should display the T&Cs section on the POCR screen, but in read-only mode. With the “ show more … “ feature working if the content of the T&Cs is greater than what can be shown in the limited space on the POCR document.  If the source PO has T&Cs assigned to it, and the system is currently configured to use custom T&Cs, then the system shoulddisplay the T&Cs section on the POCR screen, but in read-only mode. With the “ show more … “ feature working if the content of the T&Cs is greater than what can be shown in the limited space on the POCR document. Whether there will be a type-ahead, or a button to create Ad-hoc T&Cs will depend on the current user’s permissions.

epic.summary: Enhancements to Apply to All Modal for AP Documents
epic.description: This epic encompasses the development and integration of new functionalities and enhancements to the Apply to All modal on Accounts Payable (AP) documents. The objective is to align the AP system with the improvements made by the Purchase Team, ensuring consistency and enhanced user experience across both systems. The key components of this epic include: Update the behavior of the Apply to All modal on AP documents. Update the behavior of the Manage Presets tab on the Apply to All modal on AP documents. Add support for Split Accounting to the updated Apply to All modal on AP documents.

issues.summary: Add support for Split Accounting to the updated Apply to All modal on AP documents.
issues.description: This ticket MUST be released along with:     Business Case: Following the updates done in   and  , a key element is missing: the ability to apply split accounting assignments to selected line items. This enhancement aims to provide users with the ability to assign accounting splits based on quantity, value, or percent using the new Apply to All modal. We also want to enabled users to define presets with split accounting from the “Manage Presets” tab, and then use them from the “Changes to be Applied” tab. Acceptance Criteria: Note : The behavior described in this ticket MUST work consistently on all line items, regardless of how they were added to the document: Manually via the “ Add Item ” function. Created via  OCR . Created via  cXML . Created via  Supplier Portal . Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled. What pages should this change impact?  Invoice and Memo documents. Which users should be impacted by the change?  AP Processor, AP Manager, AP Coder, AP Approver with coding access, Employee/Buyer with coding access, Admin. How should this change work? UI Enhancement: A new field labeled "Split Account Assignment" should be added to the Accounting section of the Apply to All modal. The new field should have the following options: <blank>, "None", "By Quantity", "By Value", "By Percent", with <blank> as the default. Functionality for <Blank>: By default, the <blank> option should be selected. Selecting this option should maintain the current UI state. Upon application, the system should NOT make any changes to the split accounting status of the selected items. Instead, any fields which have values specified in them, should be updated across all the available accounting segments of all the selected line items. Functionality for 'None': Selecting "None" should maintain the current UI state. Upon application, the system should overwrite existing split accounting segments with the new data provided, making all fields in the Accounting section required. Functionality for 'By Quantity': Selecting "By Quantity" should dynamically add at least two sets of accounting fields. Users should be able to add additional sets of identical fields. A required field labeled "Quantity #1", "Quantity #2", etc., should be added to each set. Upon application, the system should overwrite existing split accounting segments with the new data provided, making all fields in the Accounting section required. Functionality for 'By Value': Selecting "By Value" should replicate the functionality of "By Quantity", replacing "Quantity #n" with "Value #n" fields. Functionality for 'By Percent': Selecting "By Percent" should replicate the functionality of "By Quantity", replacing "Quantity #n" with "Percent #n" fields. Application of Changes: The system should evaluate if the user's specified changes are compatible with each pre-selected line item. Compatibility for split accounting by  quantity  will be determined by comparing the sum of the quantities specified by the user, across all accounting segments, to the total order quantity of the selected line item. Compatible: If the two values  are equal , then the change can be applied. Incompatible: If the two values  are not equal , then the changes can be applied with a warning message within the “yellow” panel ( following existing system behavior for Invoice / Memo documents ). Compatibility for split accounting by  value  will be determined by comparing the sum of the values specified by the user, across all accounting segments, to the total order value of the selected line item.  Compatible: If the two values  are equal , then the change can be applied. Incompatible: If the two values  are not equal , then the changes can be applied with a warning message within the “yellow” panel ( following existing system behavior for Invoice / Memo documents ). Compatibility for split accounting by  percent  will be determined by comparing the sum of the percentages specified by the user, across all accounting segments. Compatible: If this sum adds up to “ 100 ”, then the change can be applied. Incompatible: If the sum  does not  add up to “ 100 ” or is above “ 100 ”, then the changes can be applied with a warning message within the “yellow” panel ( following existing system behavior for Invoice / Memo documents ). Error Notification: If any of the user’s selected items were updated with incompatible quantity, value or percent, and the reason for that was related to the split accounting that the user was trying to apply, then the system should display a persistent notification on the UI, informing the user about which items had incompatible values and providing a clear explanation of why they were incompatible. ( following existing system behavior for Invoice / Memo documents ). This message should be displayed on screen using the pattern for document level warning messages; within the “ yellow ” panel. If the user was trying to apply split accounting by  quantity , this message should highlight the line item number # with a warning message saying - “ Total split quantity not adding up to '<1>'   “. If the user was trying to apply split accounting by  value , this message should highlight the line item number # with a warning message saying - “ Total split value not adding up to ‘<2>’   “. If the user was trying to apply split accounting by  percent , this message should highlight the line item number # with a warning message saying - “ Total split percentage not adding up to 100% “. < 1 > :   Line item quantity . < 2 > :   Line item total . Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             FYI -   /   /   /   /   /

issues.summary: Update the behavior of the Manage Presets tab on the Apply to All modal on AP documents.
issues.description: This ticket MUST be released along with    Business Case: The behavior for the “*Apply to All*” modal needs to be updated across the application. So that users are able to change the value in as few as 1 individual field in the line items, using this mechanism. Additionally, Our system does not; currently, natively support many-to-many relationships between company info & accounting info master data objects. Many customers have worked around this limitation by creating duplicate accounting elements, each of which is connected to a different parent element. We somehow have to keep this " workaround " functioning. Acceptance Criteria: Note : The behavior described in this ticket MUST work consistently on all line items, regardless of how they were added to the document: Manually via the “ Add Item ” function. Created via  OCR . Created via  cXML . Created via  Supplier Portal . Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled. What pages should this change impact?  Invoice and Memo documents. Which users should be impacted by the change?  AP Processor, AP Manager, AP Coder, AP Approver with coding access, Employee/Buyer with coding access, Admin. How should this change work? Apply to All Functionality: There should be a "Apply to All" button in the application's user interface. This button should NOT be visible to any Employee / Buyer user that has coding restrictions enabled in their user record. The user can select one or more items before clicking the "Apply to All" button. Clicking the "Apply to All" button should open a modal dialog containing a dynamic form with multiple input fields. This modal should only show fields for the Org / Accounting elements that are enabled in the unitID. By default, all input fields in the modal should be blank. All input fields in the modal should be optional for the user to fill in. The system should only allow a user to set values in these fields that are currently “_not deleted_” and active in the unitID. Parent-Child Relationship: Some fields in the modal are considered parent elements, and others are considered child elements. If a user fills in a parent field, the system should restrict the user to selecting values in the child fields that are linked to the selected value in the parent field. This filtering mechanism must be driven off of the parent-child relationship of these elements in the unitID’s master data If a parent field has only one possible value for a child field, that value should be automatically filled in by the system. Mandatory Child Fields: If the user fills in a parent field, the system must make it mandatory for the user to fill in all linked child fields before allowing the changes to be applied to the selected items. Validation and Notification: Note: The requirements documented below mean that either the user’s entire set of specified changes will be applied to the line item, or nothing will be updated. There will not be a scenario where the user specifies changes to “ n ” child fields, but the system only updates some fraction of those “ n ” fields; as they were the only ones that would be valid with the existing parent field values on the line item. In this scenario, the entire set of specified changes will be discarded, and the user will be shown the appropriate error message. If the user is only updating child fields, the system should allow the user to apply changes. During the application of changes, the system must evaluate each selected item to determine if the user's specified change can work with the values already provided in the selected item's parent fields. If a user's specified change is incompatible with the existing parent field values, that item should remain unchanged. The system should display a persistent notification on the UI, informing the user about which items were not updated and providing a clear explanation of why they were not updated. This message should be displayed on screen using the pattern for document level warning messages; within the “*yellow*” panel. This message should highlight the items that weren’t updated using the text “* < 1 > # < 2 > not updated. The specified change conflicts with one or more of the company info or accounting elements that are already present on < 3 >. *“ < 1 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “* Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ Items *“. < 2 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should only display the index number of that item and follow that with the word “* was *”. If there are multiple consecutive items in the list, the system use the pattern  [index number of the 1st item in the list] - [index number of the last item in the list]  and follow that with the word  “were“ . If there are multiple items in the list, but they’re not consecutive, the system should list the index numbers of all those items separated by commas, with the last item in that list being separated by an “* and *”. The end of the list should be followed by the word  “were“ . < 3 > :  If there’s only one item in this list, then the system should use the word “* this Item ”. But, if there are multiple items in this list, then the system should use the word “ these Items *“. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             FYI -   /   /   /   /   /

epic.summary: Payables: Enhancements to the Invoice / Memo / Payment Request Line Item Grid; on transactional documents.
epic.description: This epic focuses on enhancing the line item grid in Invoice and Memo transactional documents to match the configuration currently used in the Purchase Requisition (PR) document. This enhancement aims to streamline the user experience, improve consistency across transactional documents, and boost overall productivity. Update the line item grid layout in Invoice and Memo documents to match the PR document.

issues.summary: AP: Enable the line item grid to show multiple values in a single table cell.
issues.description: Business Case: Based on the work done in  , we need to enable the new line item grid to be able to display multiple values per cell, in case an item has more than one value assigned to it in that field. A good example of such a use case would be items with split accounting segments assigned to them. A single item might have multiple combinations of accounting elements assigned to it, resulting in there being multiple cost objects, GL accounts, customer references etc. assigned to said item. Acceptance Criteria: Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true (and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled). What pages should this change impact?  The invoice and memos line items. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who have to access the Invoice / Memo document. How should this change work? For line items that have multiple values in a given field, the UI should display the “ 1st value  and then  +x more ”, in any cell that has more than one value. The “ x ” in this keyword is the count of the elements that are additionally associated with this line item in this field. If a certain line item is showing “ +x more ”, and the user clicks on this field in the grid, the system should show the remaining values for that field, associated with that specific line item, in a tooltip. If there are multiple Account Categories, then the tooltip should display “ Cost Center / WBS Element / Internal Order / Profit Center   :   Accounting object code   +   Name ”. Example:  Cost Center: 100 - Marketing If there are multiple splits for other accounting elements, then the tooltip should display - “ Accounting object code + Name ” (screenshot provided below). Example:  100 - Marketing Line item fields/grid columns that may include multiple values: Account Category Cost Center ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) / WBS Element / Internal Order / Profit Center GL Account ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) Customer ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) Class ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) Project ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) Location Type ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) Location ( the label for this field is configurable by the Admin ) Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: AP: Add support for user configurable labels in the grid configuration menu, and the line item grid column names
issues.description: Business Case: Based on the new line item grid developed in  , we need to ensure that the user is able to see the Custom Labels in the grid configuration menu and line item grid column names. Acceptance Criteria: Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true (and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled). What pages should this change impact?  The invoice and memos line items. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who have to access the Invoice / Memo document. How should this change work? The following field labels can be configured by Admins from the  Admin Panel → Documents → Custom Labels  screen: Cost Centers GL Accounts Customers Classes Locations Location Types Classes Company Codes Plants Purchasing Organizations Whatever labels the Admin has configured for these fields in the unitID, should be what’s displayed on the new grid configuration menu and the grid column headers as well. Reference :  Purchase Team’s original implementation -    Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: AP: Fix certain columns on the line item grid, when horizontal scrolling is enabled
issues.description: Business Case: Based on the new line item grid developed in  , we need to ensure that when the grid becomes horizontally scrollable; due to the number of columns enabled by the user. Certain columns in the grid are always visible. These columns display critical information to the user, or include controls for the user to utilize in order to affect change to the item/document. From a UX perspective, a user should never have to hunt around for these columns. Acceptance Criteria: Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true (and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled). What pages should this change impact?  The invoice and memos line items. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who have to access the Invoice / Memo document. How should this change work? If the user adds more columns than it can be displayed on the UI, the system should allow the user to scroll horizontally; within the grid, to view the additional columns. The following columns should  ALWAYS  be visible on the UI, even when the user is scrolling horizontally: Item selection Checkbox # (line item number) Description Actions Grid configuration control column (gear icon) Reference :  Purchase Team’s original implementation -    Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: AP: Make the list of available columns in the grid configuration menu dynamic, based on Admin Panel master data configurations.
issues.description: Business Case: Based on the work done in  , we need to make the list of columns a user can choose to show on the new line item grid dynamic, based on whether the underlying master data object is actually enabled in the unitID or not. Acceptance Criteria: Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true (and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled). What pages should this change impact?  The invoice and memos line items. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who have to access the Invoice / Memo document. How should this change work? For line item fields that can be enabled/disabled in the unitID, via the Admin panel: Each field’s presence in the list of columns in the grid configuration menu, should be based on whether that field is enabled for the current unitID or not. If the field/master data object is disabled in the unitID, it  SHOULD NOT BE  listed as an option in the grid configuration menu If the field/master data object is enabled in the unitID, it  SHOULD BE  listed as an option in the grid configuration menu The list of master data objects covered by this requirement is as follows: Purchasing Organization ( Based on feature toggle implementation done in this ticket  -  ) Account Category Cost Center WBS Element Internal Order Profit Center GL Accounts Customer Project Class Location Location Type Reference :  Purchase Team’s original implementation -    Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date Does the All document settings for accounting elements have any impact on how the column options would show up in the Cog wheel configuration? No impact on the invoice/memo document.      6/5/2024    /     6/5/2024 Should we be looking at updating the line item configuration on the Supplier Portal side? If yes, what changes basically?   6/5/2024

issues.summary: AP: Allow users to show the Accounting Category and associated Cost Object in a single column on the line item grid
issues.description: Business Case: Based on the work done in  , we need to allow users to display a line item’s accounting category, and the actual assigned cost object in a single column. Acceptance Criteria: Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true (and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled). What pages should this change impact?  The invoice and memos line items. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who have to access the Invoice / Memo document. How should this change work? To the grid configuration menu, add a new option in the list of available columns: This new option should be titled “ Account Category “. This option should be listed after “ Plant ” option. This option should be disabled by default. Users should be able to turn this on if they wish to do so. If the user chooses to enable the Accounting Category column: This column should show the Cost Center / WBS Element / Internal Order / Profit Center that’s actually assigned to the line item. Along with the Accounting object code + Name, the column should list the type of the accounting object assigned to the line item. E.g. If the line item has cost center "100 - Marketing" assigned to it, the UI should list it in the column as: Cost Center: 100 - Marketing Reference :  Purchase Team’s original implementation -    Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: AP: Update the Line Item Grid on the document
issues.description: Business Case: Users should be given the ability to add/remove columns from the Invoice/Memo line item grid. We need to update the grid in a way where we can enable Vroozi to continue enhancing this grid in the future. Acceptance Criteria: Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers who have ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW = true (and ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_MEMO = true, if memos are enabled). What pages should this change impact?  The invoice and memos line items. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Users who have to access the Invoice / Memo document. How should this change work? General rules for the line item grid: If a certain column does not have any data to display, it should just show up as “N/A” in the grid for that column. The user should  NEVER  be able to remove the following columns from the grid: Item selection Checkbox # Line item number Description Price Qty Total Action Grid configuration control column (gear icon) If the user adds more columns than can be displayed on the UI, the system should allow the user to scroll horizontally; within the grid, to view the additional columns. If the user chooses to show any Company Info or Accounting related columns on the grid, the UI should display both the code & name for that field’s value; from the line item. Default state of the line item grid: By default, the line item grid should continue showing the same set of columns as it does today: Item selection Checkbox # Line item number Description GL Account Price Qty Tax Total This column header should continue to display the same help tip: Total excludes 'Tax', 'Discount' and "Shipping Charges" Action <Gear icon> Allow users to update which columns are included in the line item grid: The user should be able to click on the <gear icon> Doing so will display a drop-down menu to the user; similar to the grid configuration menu on the Draft PR / Track ‘All’ Invoices screens. This menu should have a Blue header component. This menu item should be titled “ Column Preferences “. This menu should have a search box, titled “ Find a column … “. The user should be able to lookup a specific column by entering its name in this field. This field should auto-filter the list of columns, as the user types. The system should match the user’s entered text, with the column name from left to right. There is no need for token based matching. ( Ask Naufil for clarification about this ) The matching logic should be case insensitive. This menu should have a clickable link in it; under the search box, titled “ Restore Defaults “. Clicking this should undo any modifications that the user has done to the checked/unchecked status of the individual options in the list, and restore the list to the user’s default preferences. This menu should have a list of columns that can be included in the line item grid. This list should have the following options: # (line item number) Type Description GL Account (  I moved the GL here, so we keep it in the same order) Price Quantity Category Tax Code Discount Shipping Charges Tax UoM Company Code Purchasing Organization ( ) Plant Account Category ( ) Customer ( ) Project ( ) Class ( ) Location ( ) Location Type ( ) Total (   I’ve added the total here that was missing) Allow the user to apply their desired changes to the line item grid: Once the user has made their selections, they can either click on either the “ Cancel ” or “ Done ” buttons in this menu. If the user clicks on the “ Cancel ” button: none of the user’s changes will be applied to the line item grid. The grid configuration menu will automatically close. If the user clicks on the “ Done ” button: The user’s specified changes will be applied to the line item grid. These changes should be saved, and used every time the user opens up the invoice/memo document. The grid configuration menu will automatically close. Reference :  Purchase Team’s original implementation -  Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Yes. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date Check if other users can have access to this line item grid and cog wheel such as Exception handlers, Requester, Buyer, etc.        6/6/2024

epic.summary: Vroozi Accounting Validation 2024: GA Support Release: Accounting Validation at Document Creation and Line Item Save
epic.description: Vroozi Accounting Validation GA Phase#5 is post MVP phase(refer to  ) where it will become generally available for all the subscribed customers. In this phase, we will cover the following areas: Purchase Request Accounting Validation on PR Creation: Bulk Upload RFQ to PR Cart to PR API Blank PR template(not applicable) Accounting Validation at: Add/ Update line item Line item bulk upload Apply to All Purchase Order Accounting Validation on PO Creation: Creation from Buy Route Creation from PO wizard API Accounting Validation at Add/ Update line item Apply to All Apart from that, in this epic, we will improve the UX for the accounting validation process.

issues.summary: AccVal: Apply to All: The system should run the accounting validation PR Apply to All modal
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run the accounting string validations at the  Apply to All  modal. Acceptance Criteria: General Rule for Running the Accounting Validation at Document Creation: Currently, the system requires the definition of the required and optional Accounting/Organization objects in the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the value in the optional field is given at the line item, the system considers it for the accounting validation in addition to the required fields. If the value in the optional field is not given for the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. Accounting Validation on Apply to All modal: Changes to be Applied tab: On the  Changes to be Applied  tab, there are two ways to fill in the fields: Select the  preset. Select the values individually. Once the user has provided value in any or all fields required/optional for accounting validation and clicks the  Apply Changes  button, the system should run the accounting validation for the line items selected for the Apply to All.  The  Apply Changes  button labels should be changed to  Validating Data  with the in-process icon. ( refer to the Document Submit button ) The Apply to All modal should disappear if no accounting errors are found. The selected line items should be updated accordingly. The Apply to All modal should disappear if accounting errors are found. The selected line items should be updated accordingly. The accounting validation error message should appear above the line item grid on the document stating the line items selected for Apply to All and their invalid accounting strings. The user can go further to the line item individually to rectify the accounting string issue. The following Red highlighted section is not required at this point. On the  Changes to be Applied  tab, there are two ways to fill in the fields: Select the  preset. Select the values individually. The system should run the accounting validation as soon as it finds values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  on the  Changes to be Applied  tab of the  Apply to All  modal. If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system green message. The message should disappear in 3 seconds. If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should show the following message This message should persist until the user resolves the issue. The system should run the accounting validation as soon as it finds values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service Changes to be Applied  tab of the  Apply to All  modal. If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system green message. The message should disappear in 3 seconds. If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should show the following message This message should persist until the user resolves the issue. The error message should be as follows when the line item is not split. Accounting String Error  The following Accounting String has been deactivated  → Error Code 02 The following Accounting String is not valid (does not exist)  → Error Code 01 Company Code = <Code> - <Description> Plant Code = <Code> - <Description> Cost Center / WBS Element / Internal Order = <Code> - <Description> GL Account = <Code> - <Description> … (display the rest of the elements in the same order the line items in separate lines) There should be a separate error message for each invalid accounting string associated with different splits on the  Changes to be Applied  tab of the  Apply to All  modal. The following is the pattern of the error message that should be followed: Accounting String Error - split #…  → Display all splits of the item containing that Accounting String The following Accounting String has been deactivated  → Error Code 02 The following Accounting String is not valid (does not exist)  → Error Code 01 Company Code = <Code> - <Description> Plant Code = <Code> - <Description> Cost Center / WBS Element / Internal Order = <Code> - <Description> GL Account = <Code> - <Description> … (display the rest of the elements in the same order the line items in separate lines) The message should read “Accounting String Error - split # (comma separated).“. The message should read “Accounting String Error - split # (- separated).“ in case of splits in the sequence has the same accounting string error. After the message should tell the user why the selected accounting string combination of the mentioned line items was marked invalid. Either the string was deactivated. Or the string does not exist in Vroozi Master Data. The message should display the associated accounting combination with the mentioned splits in the strings. Please review the error message on the documents above the line item grid. The system should keep the  Apply Changes  button disabled until the accounting validation error message persists. Please note that the R&D done so far does not show any instance in which a certain accounting object is required in the accounting configuration service and is optional on the line item modal.  So making this the basis for our assumption, we can say that the above-scenario can happen technically but not practically. QA can run such scenarios in their testing activity.  If there is any custom accounting validation error message that exits, it should also be visible on the Apply to All modal with the main message. (refer to  )  All AC points mentioned above should be implemented for the following documents where users can access the  Apply to All  Modal. PR CR PO Create PO Wizard POCR All AC points mentioned above should be implemented for the following users who can take action on the documents listed above. Admin Requester Sourcing Approver (with Editing rights) Financial Approver (with Coding rights) Buyer Central Receiver Any other user( QA: Please do the impact analysis and let me know If I have missed any user ) Manage Presets: All the acceptance criteria mentioned in the  Changes to be Applied tab  should be implemented for the  Manage Presets  tab of the  Apply  to All modal. On selecting the existing preset on the Manage Presets tab, the system should not run accounting validation until the user changes values in the fields required for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  on the  Manage Presets  tab of the  Apply to All  modal. Testing Strategy: ,  , Kindly document the testing Strategy here in the panel that how the team is going to cover all the mentioned documents and users while testing the Accounting Validation at  Apply to All  Modal.
